TextView.android:text: Medi Share Expert Answers the Most Important Questions on Flu:
1. What are the symptoms of the flu?

As a healthcare professional, I can tell you that the common symptoms of flu include: Fever, Chills, Body aches, Headache, Cough, Sore throat, Fatigue, Weakness, Nasal congestion, Runny nose, Additionally, some patients may experience gastrointestinal symptoms such as: Nausea, Vomiting, Diarrhea. It's important to note that the severity and presentation of symptoms may vary from person to person.
It's important to seek medical attention if you experience any of these symptoms, as some of them can also be present in other illnesses.
a) Avoid close contact with people who are sick. When you are sick, keep your distance from others to protect them from getting sick too.
b) If possible, stay home from work, school, and errands when you are sick. This will help prevent spreading your illness to others.

c) Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing. It may prevent those around you from getting sick. Flu viruses spread mainly by droplets made when people with flu cough, sneeze or talk.
